content:
Sure, I can provide some examples of questions that recruiters might ask during a call:

1. Tell me about your previous experience.
2. Why are you interested in this position?
3. What are your biggest strengths and weaknesses?
4. Can you give me an example of a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation?
5. How do you prioritize tasks and manage your time effectively?
6. What are your salary expectations for this position?
7. What are your long-term career goals?
8. How would your previous colleagues or supervisors describe your work style?
9. What do you know about our company and why do you want to work here?
10. Can you walk me through a recent project you worked on and your role in it?

These are just a few examples, but there are many other questions that recruiters might ask depending on the position and the company. It's a good idea to research the company and the job description ahead of time so that you can be prepared to answer any questions that come up.
